title: Disconnected players should passively gain some exp and extra gold
body: Obviously not enough to compare to those who are actually in the match, but this change would help keep players who just reconnected after being dc'd for 10 minutes from becoming walking ATMs for the enemy team.

Idk if you have ever d/c'ed from a match and come back but it is really easy to catch back up in exp. Gold is another story but you can catch up from level 3 to level 10 if everyone in the game is 12-13 in 2-3 minion waves.

What I mean by this is that there is no level of passive exp that will matter without being exploitable. Who cares if you d'c at 3 and are now 5 it only saves you one wave tops.

Gold is another story but how much is enough to make a difference without being exploitable by the support? The bot lane can be a passive lane that can't really exploit being in a 1v2 like braum and vayne vs a champion that can farm decently alone like cait and at that point if there is even an argument for "d/c is the best strategy" then it is a bad mechanic.

As for gold, it's a team decision - do you give farm to the player that needs to catch up, or give more feed to your strongest champ to boost them up. Either way, a little common sense play on the player that is behind will allow them to catch up as long as the team is willing to work around the deficiency.

How to balance this

 Let's say you get DCed and while you are gone your 4 allies accumulate 1000 exp and 600g

That then transfers to you on reconnect at a 100% the average so you get 1000/5 and 600/5 resulting in 200 exp and 102g on reconnect

It's a minuscule 20% of what your team accumulated while you were DC. This of course can be number tuned to a lower percentage to prevent abuse but the idea is you would not be entirely behind bust still noticeably weaker than you allies who didn't DC

This would give the support about what they would have gotten in lane exp wise but noticeably less gold and they lose them being there for pressure which puts the lane on a losing term to begin with with a 1v2 so the adc will be getting less gold and exp if the enemy knows how to abuse it

The gold income would be noticeably less than what the support would have got in lane

And let's say the top DCed, he ends up with much less gold and exp on return to game than if he stayed connected and in lane

DC doesn't just cost the team gold and exp, it costs the team pressure as well

The idea is the DC return will give them about what a support would get in lane for exp and gold, so even if the support DC and comes back when his adc is lvl 6 (assuming it happened at start of game) the support would get back to lane after reconnect at lvl 3-4 instead of lvl 1

You know someone would work out the math (or make a program to do so) and say "wow, you'd have more gold and levels if you just AFKed" and people would either leave the game to catch up or leave because they were frustrated.
